Using Mylar 0.6.2, I tried to Add Existing Task, and got the following error:

-- Error Log --
Date: Tue Sep 05 18:15:50 BRT 2006
Message: Error creating task from key 52

Severity: Info
Plugin ID: org.eclipse.mylar.core
Stack Trace:
org.eclipse.mylar.internal.trac.core.TracLoginException
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.trac.core.Trac09Client.authenticate(Trac09Client.java:121)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.trac.core.Trac09Client.connectInternal(Trac09Client.java:110)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.trac.core.Trac09Client.connect(Trac09Client.java:77)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.trac.core.Trac09Client.getTicket(Trac09Client.java:153)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.trac.TracRepositoryConnector.createTaskFromExistingKey(TracRepositoryConnector.java:151)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasks.ui.wizards.CommonAddExistingTaskWizard$1.run(CommonAddExistingTaskWizard.java:63)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

Trac's access_log shows just a GET on the ticket URL, by "Jakarta Commons-HttpClient/3.0", with a 401 response.
Mylar didn't prompt me for authentication. IIRC, this worked with Mylar 0.6.1. I mean, I known I've added existing tasks from my Trac repository (with 0.6.1), but I don't remember if I did any extra steps before trying to add the task. BTW, my Trac uses Digest auth.
Could you try to validate the repository properties in the Task Repositories view? The credentials are discarded when the Eclipse configuration data is lost (e.g. by running eclipse -clean).

Thanks, validating the repository properties in the Task Repositories view did solve the problem. IMHO, Mylar should handle this case more gracefully, asking the user to authenticate instead of just logging the error.

An error message should now be displayed if adding of an existing task fails.

Rob, could you take a look at the attached patch. Currently two dialogs pop up in case of an error.

Created an attachment (id=49717)
Only show a single dialog in case of an error
